_comment: Only useful for a Pytornado simulation
Only useful for a Pytornado simulation, Put the name not the file. Nevertheless
the file should be in cwd/CFD/aircraft/
CFD solver choice. Implemented choices are: Pytornado, SU2
Number of processors used for a SU2 simulation. Pytornado is always one, but has
one step where he sees and use all available processors, no parameter neded though
Number of iterations done with SU2 for each aeroelastic iterations
Configuration file path for the SU2 solver. Will not be red if the CFD solver is SU2
Could be interseting if the restart function is used. Currently deactivated in python
Accepted entrires are: FramAT, external
Maximal number of allowed iterations
Maximal displacement in [m] between two iterations
Does the deformation needs to be taken into account
G load activation, if false G loads are not taken into account
If G_loads are acvtivated, the user can impose the straight level flight loading case
If deformation is activated, path + name to the deformation file
Deprecated
Fuselage instance comes here, if no fuselage do not put one
Wing innstance, Add each wing after this one with the same indentation level.
naming should follow the order the CPACS construction but not the name.
Wing must be named 'wing*' where * is the number and this number should be from 1 to n.

wing1._comment: chordlength at which the axis is from the elasticAxis. + is behind the elastic axis, - is before

mechanicalProperties._comment: Second moment of aera in the horizontal direciton [m^4]
Second moment of aera in the vertical direciton [m^4]
Polar moment of aera [m^4]. Do not forget J = Iz + Iy

FEM._comment: Poportionalty factor for a taperd wing. Accepeted choices are: constant, linear, quadratic
Number of structure node for this instance
Number of clamped nodes at the wing root. This permits to mitigate the
mismatch phenomena at the wing root
